title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed.
OB: The children node listing is not displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: The children node listing should be displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without any SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 
3. Change the data source to a new one that has no database/table/column information. 
4. Observe that the children node listing is not displayed. 
5. Close the data set editor and reopen it. 
6. Repeat steps 2-4 and verify that the children node listing is still not displayed.
